Class MapData

  • java.lang.Object
    • MapData

  • public class MapData
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    10/28/2018 A class that takes in the time and date of a weather measurement, and outputs a String containing the maximum, minimum, and average, of the air temperature at 1.5 meters, the air temperature at 9 meters, and the solar radiation.
    Author:
    Grant Campbell

    • Field Detail

      • dataCatalog

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<Observation>> dataCatalog
        HashMap with a String key and an ArrayList value. Used to store data from the .mdf files.

      • statistics

        private java.util.EnumMap<StatsType,java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,Statistics>> statistics
        EnumMap containing significant Stats for each parameter.

      • paramPositions

        private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> paramPositions
        TreeMap containing the positions of each parameter on the file. Param name String is the key.

      • tempStatHolder

        java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,Statistics> tempStatHolder
        TreeMap that temporarily holds statistics as they are moved into the statistics EnumMap.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapData

        public MapData(java.lang.String filename)
        A constuctor for the MapData class. Takes in the file name and splits it into the date, then pushed the data through the rest of the program
        Parameters:
        filename - The file address for the data

      • MapData

        public MapData(int year,
               int month,
               int day,
               int hour,
               int minute,
               java.lang.String directory)
        A constuctor for the MapData class. Takes in information about the file requested, and pushes the data through the rest of the program
        Parameters:
        year - The year the data was collected
        month - The month the data was collected
        day - The day the data was collected
        hour - The hour the data was collected
        minute - The minute the data was collected
        directory - The folder in which the data is stored

      • createFileName

        public java.lang.String createFileName(int year,
                                       int month,
                                       int day,
                                       int hour,
                                       int minute,
                                       java.lang.String directory)
        Uses the date and time to create a file name based on that data
        Parameters:
        year - The year the data was recorded
        month - The month the data was recorded
        day - The day the data was recorded
        hour - The hour the data was recorded
        minute - The minute the data was recorded
        directory - The directory holding the recorded data
        Returns:
        currentFileName The fileName of the requested data

      • parseParamHeader

        private void parseParamHeader(java.lang.String inParamString)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Finds the position in an array of each parameter requested
        Parameters:
        inParamString - The entry point for the method
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an invalid input is used

      • parseFile

        public void parseFile()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Calls the createFileName method and pulls in the data from that file. The data is then sorted into arrays corresponding to the correct statistic. After bringing in the data the arrays are resized from a capacity of 1000 to one of a perfect size.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws an exception of a input is invalid

      • calculateAllStatistics

        private void calculateAllStatistics(java.util.ArrayList<Observation> inData,
                                    java.lang.String paramId)
        Uses the ArrayLists created by the parseFile method to calculate the maximum, minimum, average, and totals for each parameter. The calculations only use the valid data.
        Parameters:
        inData - The ArrayList that is being used
        paramId - The parameter type having statistics calculated

      • prepareDataCatalog

        private void prepareDataCatalog()
        Initializes the dataCatalog for 'this' Object.

      • calculateStatistics

        private void calculateStatistics()
        Calculates the statistics for each requested parameter.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Creates and returns a String that is the final output for the program. The string contains the weather statistics as well as the date and time. Each section of the data is separated by a line of "=".
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        output the final output String that will print to the console
